sentences.english: The traditional melodrama of the wicked squire and rustic tenant.
sentences.chinese: 關於邪惡鄉紳和土氣佃農的傳統傳奇劇。

sentences.english: Hellip; and now you're a sharecropper on the Google plantation.
sentences.chinese: 現在你是一個佃農的谷歌人工林。

sentences.english: He has a bunch of sharecroppers working for him.
sentences.chinese: 他有一幫收益分成的佃農幫他幹活兒。

sentences.english: Many are crofters, but nearly everyone has more than one job.
sentences.chinese: 他們很多是佃農，但幾乎人人都不只一份工作。

sentences.english: Under the system, surface field has become an independent property-right of the rural tenants.
sentences.chinese: 雙層地權制之下，田面已經成爲佃農的一項獨立產權。

definition: One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
